intro: Senecio microspermus, commonly known as the narrowleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio microspermus is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
